sn9.4:2.1: The idiom viya me khāyati (“seems to me”) is used for suppositions, so it must refer to the presumed dissatisfaction of the mendicants, rather than the disappointment of the deity.
sn9.4:4.4: A Brahmanical renunciate is said to wander “without fire or abode” (anagniraniketa, Manusmṛti 6.25, 6.43).
